content:
Seems like a newly created account is doing many reviews in rust-lang org: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/67792
Wonder if they are bot or not ?
Is that the correct link?
should have the account link: https://github.com/castroed47 :)
the link for their reviews: https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/243#pullrequestreview-565369609
hmm, another cryptocurrency scam https://github.com/castroed47/Referral-You-earn-0.006-BCH-per-referral-Minimum-of-2-Referrals-Your-Ref.-Link-https-t.me-

more their reviews links:

  • https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/204?notification_referrer_id=MDE4Ok5vdGlmaWNhdGlvblRocmVhZDM5ODkyMzY2OjE1MjI1OTAy&notifications_query=is%3Adone#pullrequestreview-565370094
  • https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76041?notification_referrer_id=MDE4Ok5vdGlmaWNhdGlvblRocmVhZDExMDQxMTU4NjA6MTUyMjU5MDI%3D&notifications_query=is%3Adone#pullrequestreview-565361327
  • https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/3058?notification_referrer_id=MDE4Ok5vdGlmaWNhdGlvblRocmVhZDE0Njk1MjA0MDE6MTUyMjU5MDI%3D&notifications_query=is%3Adone#issuecomment-757957140
reported the user
I canâ€™t believe they are still active. I reported them some more this morning and locked the RFC they opened.
Reported them too.
https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/issues/3063
Should I lock the conversation as spam?
for the future, the right course of action is to email mods - rust-mods@rust-lang.org
@simulacrum why is that? They are general GitHub nuisances, so why not report them via GH methods? If they were violating just the Rust CoC, then I'd see involving the moderators.
the moderators will handle the reporting of accounts to GH
reporting via github is fine, but rust-mods are not just about CoC; they're the people to reach out to for any moderation action on rust platforms (e.g., blocking the user)
and closing the issue or removing whatever needs to
it is likely that the mods would have taken action on the first step - basically, there's no need to wait for github
See, I view it as there are like 3 Rust mods and presumably many more GH mods. I want to reserve our mods time for the important stuff.

it's probably not great to encourage reporting people on suspicion
without some oversight

@Jake Goulding Moderators also want to know about issues so they can look for broader patterns across reports. And moderators have tools to respond quickly, before a larger entity like GitHub can notice.
